page.title: 11Haslington-Children's Games.
page.content: The survey concentrated on children in the school playground and fell into four categories: 1.{Traditional: }ring-o-roses,follow my leader. 2.{Boys v Girls: }chasing and catching each other and payment of a "fine" e.g. a kiss is "paid" before release. 3.{Copying happenings in popular {television programmes:}e.g. army games,the"A-Team""Knight Rider" where players are split into two sides and pretend physical contact takes place. 4. {Practice of Physical Skills}: handstands,netball,cricket,football etc. Overall fewer traditional games are played and the influence of television and film is more pronounced.
